item.title: USA Drone Developer website hacked by anon
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

What exact missions are performed at those locations, however, is not clear. Some bases might be used as remote cockpits to control the robotic aircraft overseas, some for drone pilot training. Others may also serve as imagery analysis depots.

These seem like legit reasons to have drone bases in the US. Spying on citizens, in the name of ‘the war on terrorism’, is something I oppose though.

Read full topic
item.source: USA Drone Developer website hacked by anon

item.title: USA Drone Developer website hacked by anon
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Pwnd:

http://www.wired.com/dangerroom/2012/06/64-drone-bases-on-us-soil/

Domestic proliferation isn’t the same as domestic spying, however. Most — if not all — of these military bases would make poor surveillance centers. Many of the locations are isolated, far from civilian populations. Almost half of the bases on the map work only with the relatively small Raven and Shadow drones; their limited range and endurance make them imperfect spying tools, at best. It’s safe to assume that most of the bases are just used for military training.

Read full topic

item.title: USA Drone Developer website hacked by anon
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

WIRED

Revealed: 64 Drone Bases on American Soil

We like to think of the drone war as something far away, fought in the deserts of Yemen or the mountains of Afghanistan. But we now know it's closer than we thought. There are 64 drone bases on American soil. That includes 12 locations housing...

item.title: USA Drone Developer website hacked by anon
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:29, topic:443262”]The best way would be withdrawing all the Western people from Afghanistan, Pakistan and Iran and nuke the area. The baddies get killed, and your soldiers won’t need to risk their lives.

Luckily, most civilized countries don’t work like that. I’m not against using drones to kill enemies, but I am against any form of attack without even knowing if your target is there. We live in the age where bombs can hit a target almost to the millimeter, yet we still resort to shooting with our eyes closed.[/quote]

There’s no doubt that bombing innocent civilians is inhumane, fuck, bombing anyone is inhumane. It’s just cost effective for us (in terms of lives). Figure out a way to conduct war without civilian casualties and I’m sure you would be the one in charge.

Read full topic

[/quote]

The best way would be withdrawing all the Western people from Afghanistan, Pakistan and Iran and nuke the area. The baddies get killed, and your soldiers won’t need to risk their lives.[/quote]

item.title: USA Drone Developer website hacked by anon
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

`Alec:

I didn’t want you to get angry, I was just trying to say that some of the drone strikes kill our intended targets without our soldiers needing to risk their lives.

The best way would be withdrawing all the Western people from Afghanistan, Pakistan and Iran and nuke the area. The baddies get killed, and your soldiers won’t need to risk their lives.

Luckily, most civilized countries don’t work like that. I’m not against using drones to kill enemies, but I am against any form of attack without even knowing if your target is there. We live in the age where bombs can hit a target almost to the millimeter, yet we still resort to shooting with our eyes closed.

Read full topic
